question: Which sorting algorithm has the worst-case time complexity of O(n^2)?
Which sorting algorithm divides the list into two sublists and recursively applies the same algorithm to each sublist?
Which sorting algorithm is known for its divide-and-conquer approach and has an average-case time complexity of O(n log n)?
Which sorting algorithm repeatedly compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order?
Which sorting algorithm selects the smallest (or largest) element from the unsorted portion of the list and swaps it with the element at the beginning of the unsorted portion?
